meanings.definition: To sting or whip with or as if with nettles.
meanings.sent1: The plants in the garden urticate my skin when I touch them.
meanings.sent2: Bees can urticate with their stingers to protect their hive.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally urticated myself while trying to pick flowers in the field.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words from the teacher seemed to urticate the student's feelings.
meanings.sent5: The nettle's leaves urticate unsuspecting passersby, causing discomfort.

meanings.sent1: The cold wind urticates my cheeks as I walk outside.
meanings.sent2: The spicy food can urticate your tongue if you are not used to it.
meanings.sent3: The loud music seemed to urticate the baby, making her cry.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal by a friend can urticate one's heart more than any physical pain.
meanings.sent5: The strong scent of the perfume urticated my nose, making me sneeze.
